result.execSummary:
The defendant Kalvin Mehran A Paige was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Huber with standard release conditions to commence FORTHWITH.  Sentence credit for 69 days were granted.
Concurrent with: any other sentence.

DNA previously done.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Kalvin Mehran A Paige in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Morin makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1.  
Sentence of:
180 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  Concurrent to any other sentence.  (Credit - 69 days). Commences immediately.
COSTS:  $268.00 Waived
DNA previously done. 
Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Defendant Kalvin Mehran A Paige in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
